        public boolean isFixedPitch()
        This is a style bit, advance widths may vary even if this returns true.
        Returns:
        true if the typeface claims to be fixed-pitch

      • getVariations

        @Nullable
public @Nullable FontVariation[] getVariations()
        It is possible the number of axes can be retrieved but actual position cannot.
        Returns:
        the variation coordinates describing the position of this typeface in design variation space, null if there’s no variations

      • getVariationAxes

        @Nullable
public @Nullable FontVariationAxis[] getVariationAxes()
        It is possible the number of axes can be retrieved but actual position cannot.
        Returns:
        the variation coordinates describing the position of this typeface in design variation space, null if there’s no variations

        public int getUniqueId()
        Returns:

      • makeFromName

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Typeface makeFromName​(java.lang.String name,
                                             FontStyle style)
        Creates a new reference to the typeface that most closely matches the requested name and style. This method allows extended font face specifiers as in the FontStyle type. Will never return null.
        Parameters:
        name - May be null. The name of the font family
        style - The style of the typeface
        Returns:
        reference to the closest-matching typeface

      • makeClone

        public Typeface makeClone​(FontVariation variation)
        Return a new typeface based on this typeface but parameterized as specified in the variation. If the variation does not supply an argument for a parameter in the font then the value from this typeface will be used as the value for that argument.
        Returns:
        same typeface if variation already matches, new typeface otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - on failure

      • makeClone

        public Typeface makeClone​(FontVariation[] variations)
        Return a new typeface based on this typeface but parameterized as specified in the variations. If the variations does not supply an argument for a parameter in the font then the value from this typeface will be used as the value for that argument.
        Returns:
        same typeface if all variation already match, new typeface otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - on failure

      • makeClone

        public Typeface makeClone​(FontVariation[] variations,
                          int collectionIndex)
        Return a new typeface based on this typeface but parameterized as specified in the variations. If the variations does not supply an argument for a parameter in the font then the value from this typeface will be used as the value for that argument.
        Returns:
        same typeface if all variation already match, new typeface otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - on failure

      • getUTF32Glyph

        public short getUTF32Glyph​(int unichar)
        This is a short-cut for calling getUTF32Glyphs(int[]).
        Returns:
        the glyph that corresponds to the specified unicode code-point (in UTF32 encoding). If the unichar is not supported, returns 0

      • getTableData

        @Nullable
public @Nullable Data getTableData​(java.lang.String tag)
        Return an immutable copy of the requested font table, or null if that table was not found.
        Parameters:
        tag - The table tag whose contents are to be copied
        Returns:
        an immutable copy of the table's data, or null

      • getUnitsPerEm

        public int getUnitsPerEm()
        Returns:
        the units-per-em value for this typeface, or zero if there is an error

      • getKerningPairAdjustments

        @Nullable
public @org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable int[] getKerningPairAdjustments​(short[] glyphs)
        Given a run of glyphs, return the associated horizontal adjustments. Adjustments are in "design units", which are integers relative to the typeface's units per em (see getUnitsPerEm()). Some typefaces are known to never support kerning. Calling this with null, if it returns null then it will always return null (no kerning) for all possible glyph runs. If it returns int[0], then it *may* return non-null adjustments for some glyph runs.
        Returns:
        adjustment array (one less than glyphs), or null if no kerning should be applied

      • getFamilyNames

        public FontFamilyName[] getFamilyNames()
        Returns:
        all of the family names specified by the font

      • getFamilyName

        public java.lang.String getFamilyName()
        Returns:
        the family name for this typeface. The language of the name is whatever the host platform chooses

      • getBounds

        public io.github.humbleui.types.Rect getBounds()
        Return a rectangle (scaled to 1-pt) that represents the union of the bounds of all of the glyphs, but each one positioned at (0,). This may be conservatively large, and will not take into account any hinting or other size-specific adjustments.
